dublin_core.dcvalue: The shortage of otolaryngologists and the high incidence of ear disease in remote areas are major problems in Australia We have developed a multimedia course for primary care providers that incorporates material about ear anatomy and physiology ear disease video otoscopy and telemedicine software The computer based course was followed by a practical one day course A multiple choice test was given to participants before and at the end of the course and a form was used to record feedback The course was conducted with 30 aboriginal health workers The participants were able to obtain images of reasonable to good quality after a short period of training There was an average improvement of about 25 in the test scores and the feedback regarding the course was extremely positive The CD ROM and the Website provide a valuable resource to assist primary care providers in their care of patients with ear disorders
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-12T11:37:42Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2004-01-19
A tele-otology course for primary care providers.
